## Description {#details}

Crash recovery helper object.

This class implements support for running operations in a safe context so that crashes (memory errors, stack overflow, assertion violations) can be detected and control restored to the crashing thread. Crash detection is purely &quot;best effort&quot;, the exact set of failures which can be recovered from is platform dependent.

Clients make use of this code by first calling <a href="#a41167e1234529f6607af068e6c687ac0">CrashRecoveryContext::Enable()</a>, and then executing unsafe operations via a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext">CrashRecoveryContext</a> object. For example:


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> actual&#95;work(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> foo() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#af9b65412e2f06422a5500e533cb3982d">CrashRecoveryContext</a> CRC;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!CRC.RunSafely(actual&#95;work, 0)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">     ... a crash was detected, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/memprof/anonymous-memprofreader-cpp-/#a5aa1da33006dea5aabda2768e34787b8">report</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/codeview/symbolrecordmapping-cpp/#a9cdf893c7d17e47fa1ed8bebf92a5da4">error</a> to user ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  ... no crash was detected ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

To assist recovery the class allows specifying set of actions that will be executed in any case, whether crash occurs or not. These actions may be used to reclaim resources in the case of crash.

Definition at line 46 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h">CrashRecoveryContext.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### HandleExit() {#a37a76700bffd3d25b09e7828fa90277c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void CrashRecoveryContext::HandleExit (int RetCode)">
Explicitly trigger a crash recovery in the current process, and return failure from <a href="#a7a27e5f3ab2b30dd6b1ef4c8d7e9e5a4">RunSafely()</a>.

This function does not return.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h/#l00102">102</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h">CrashRecoveryContext.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/crashrecoverycontext-cpp/#l00432">432</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/crashrecoverycontext-cpp">CrashRecoveryContext.cpp</a>.

### registerCleanup() {#acfd8df959280984cf865bc8690aa1386}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void CrashRecoveryContext::registerCleanup (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontextcleanup">CrashRecoveryContextCleanup</a> &#42; cleanup)</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> cleanup handler, which is used when the recovery context is finished.

The recovery context owns the handler.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h/#l00057">57</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h">CrashRecoveryContext.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/crashrecoverycontext-cpp/#l00157">157</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/crashrecoverycontext-cpp">CrashRecoveryContext.cpp</a>.

### RunSafely() {#a7a27e5f3ab2b30dd6b1ef4c8d7e9e5a4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CrashRecoveryContext::RunSafely (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt; void()&gt; Fn)</>}>
Execute the provided callback function (with the given arguments) in a protected context.

<SectionUser title="Returns">
True if the function completed successfully, and false if the function crashed (or HandleCrash was called explicitly). Clients should make as little assumptions as possible about the program state when RunSafely has returned false.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h/#l00081">81</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h">CrashRecoveryContext.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/crashrecoverycontext-cpp/#l00413">413</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/crashrecoverycontext-cpp">CrashRecoveryContext.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::CrashRecoveryContext::RunSafely (void(&#42;)(void &#42;) Fn, void &#42; UserData)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>

### RunSafelyOnThread() {#afdaeace1ba646601aab05b0530f7f1db}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CrashRecoveryContext::RunSafelyOnThread (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt; void()&gt; Fn, unsigned RequestedStackSize=0)</>}>
Execute the provide callback function (with the given arguments) in a protected context which is run in another thread (optionally with a requested stack size).

See <a href="#a7a27e5f3ab2b30dd6b1ef4c8d7e9e5a4">RunSafely()</a>.

On Darwin, if PRIO&#95;DARWIN&#95;BG is set on the calling thread, it will be propagated to the new thread as well.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h/#l00094">94</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h">CrashRecoveryContext.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/crashrecoverycontext-cpp/#l00512">512</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/crashrecoverycontext-cpp">CrashRecoveryContext.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Public Member Attributes

### DumpStackAndCleanupOnFailure {#a77f0ee6230e867e6e35366aba64a325f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::CrashRecoveryContext::DumpStackAndCleanupOnFailure = false">
Selects whether handling of failures should be done in the same way as for regular crashes.

When this is active, a crash would print the callstack, clean-up any temporary files and create a coredump/minidump.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h/#l00117">117</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h">CrashRecoveryContext.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
